title: (x) Macromedia initials - custom {Paul Magee}
content:
what's the font on macromedia's programs?   
   
like the "f" of flash, the "d" of dreamweaver, the "cf" of cold fusion, ...
author: primavera

comments.content: As far as I understand it Neville Brody's studio do the whole Macromedia suit branding. So I figure it will be oneof his own... some elements of it smell of his FF Typeface Six but with a more modern interpretation
From what I know, the MX series icons/packaging was done by Landor.
In all honesty, I like the old ones better...

Macromedia's corporate face (not used for the individual product icons, of course) is Vonnes. It's a Font Bureau reworking of the venerable Venus.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/venus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113200415/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/venus/)   
   
Font Bureau used to list Vonnes in a "Custom" section which, sadly, no longer exists.
